books.author: George Orwell
books.comments: A really good book that makes clear the problems with government control and to be cautious when turning over your freedom for safety.

books.name: Beacon 23
books.author: Hugh Howey
books.comments: A story of a man living alone in the deep recess of space at a lighthouse. Suffering completely alone, just how he likes it.

books.name: Metro 2033
books.author: Dmitry Glukhovsky
books.comments: A very russian book of people living underground in the metros of moscow russia after nuclear war. You really feel like you are there and is an amazing book!

books.name: Metro 2034
books.author: Dmitry Glukhovsky
books.comments: The sequel to 2033 with a very different vibe to it. You don't feel like your there and its more of an action book. if you like the first one you will probably not like this one...

books.name: The Strange Affair of Spring Heel Jack
books.author: Mark Hodder
books.comments: An alternate history of science and technology. Mark Hodder really knows his history and changes it to fit perfectly in this strange tail of historical scifi mystery.

books.name: The Curious Case of the Clockwork Man
books.author: Mark Hodder
books.comments: The first half is kind of boring, especially compared to the excellent book that the first one was. The second half picks up and is much closer to the feel of the first though it takes a while to get there.

books.name: Expedition to the Mountains of the Moon
books.author: Mark Hodder

books.name: Drink: A Cultural History of Alcohol
books.author: Iain Gately
